testpager.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include "testpager.h"
00002 #include "pmsg.h"
00003 #include <string.h>
00004 
00005 #define NUM_BLOCKS_IN_FILE 20 /* can be greater than NUM_PAGES */
00006 #define NUM_RECORDS_IN_BLOCK 3
00007 static int ints_in[NUM_RECORDS_IN_BLOCK] = {10, 20, 30};
00008 static char* strs_in[NUM_RECORDS_IN_BLOCK] = {"a char string", "and yet", "another one"};
00009 static size_t str_len = 14;
00010 
00011 
00012 void test_page_write (  const char *fname )
00013 {
00014   put_msg (INFO, "test_page_write() ...\n");
00015   pager_init ();
00016   /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After pager_init"); */
00017         
00018   page_p pg;
00019   int bnr;
00020   for (bnr = 0; bnr < NUM_BLOCKS_IN_FILE; bnr++)
00021     {
00022       pg = get_page ( fname, bnr );
00023       /* alternatively, append. But beware that the file grows
00024          with every run of the test
00025          pg = get_page_for_append ( fname );
00026       */
00027       if ( pg == NULL)
00028         {
00029           put_msg (FATAL, "get_page %d fails\n", bnr);
00030           put_pager_info (FATAL, "After get_page");
00031           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00032         }
00033 
00034       /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After get_page"); */
00035 
00036       int i;
00037       for (i=0; i<NUM_RECORDS_IN_BLOCK; i++)
00038         {
00039           page_put_int(pg, ints_in[i] + bnr);
00040           page_put_str(pg, strs_in[i], str_len);
00041           /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After writing a record"); */
00042         }
00043 
00044       /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "Before write_page"); */
00045       write_page (pg);
00046       unpin (pg);
00047       /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After unpin"); */
00048     }
00049 
00050   put_pager_profiler_info (INFO);       
00051   pager_terminate ();
00052   /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After pager_terminate"); */
00053   put_msg (INFO, "test_page_write() done.\n");
00054 }
00055 
00056 void test_page_read (  const char *fname )
00057 {
00058   put_msg (INFO, "test_page_read() ...\n");
00059   pager_init ();
00060   /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After pager_init"); */
00061         
00062   page_p pg;
00063   int int_out;
00064   char str_out[14];
00065 
00066   int bnr;
00067   for (bnr = 0; bnr < NUM_BLOCKS_IN_FILE; bnr++)
00068     {
00069       pg = get_page ( fname, bnr );
00070       if ( pg == NULL)
00071         {
00072           put_msg (FATAL, "get_page %d fails\n", bnr);
00073           put_pager_info (FATAL, "After get_page");
00074           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00075         }
00076 
00077       /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After get_page"); */
00078 
00079       int i = 0;
00080       while (!eob(pg))
00081         {
00082           int_out = page_get_int(pg);
00083           if ( int_out != ints_in[i] + bnr )
00084             {
00085               put_msg (FATAL,
00086                        "test_page_read fails: (read: %d, should be %d)\n",
00087                        int_out, ints_in[i] + bnr);
00088               put_pager_info (FATAL, "After page_get_int");
00089               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00090             }
00091           page_get_str (pg, str_out, str_len);
00092           if ( strcmp (str_out, strs_in[i]) != 0 )
00093             {
00094               put_msg (FATAL,
00095                        "test_page_read fails: (read: \"%s\", should be \"%s\")\n",
00096                        str_out, strs_in[i] + bnr);
00097               put_pager_info (FATAL, "After page_get_str");
00098               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00099             }
00100           i++;
00101         }
00102       unpin (pg);
00103     }
00104 
00105   put_pager_profiler_info (INFO);       
00106   pager_terminate ();
00107   /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After pager_terminate"); */
00108   put_msg (INFO, "test_page_read() succeeds.\n");
00109 }
00110 
00111 void test_page_write_with_offset (  const char *fname )
00112 {
00113   put_msg (INFO, "test_page_write_with_offset() ...\n");
00114   pager_init ();
00115   /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After pager_init"); */
00116         
00117   page_p pg;
00118   int bnr;
00119   for (bnr = 0; bnr < NUM_BLOCKS_IN_FILE; bnr++)
00120     {
00121       pg = get_page ( fname, bnr );
00122       if ( pg == NULL)
00123         {
00124           put_msg (FATAL, "get_page %d fails\n", bnr);
00125           put_pager_info (FATAL, "After get_page");
00126           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00127         }
00128 
00129       /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After get_page"); */
00130 
00131       int i;
00132       for (i=0; i<NUM_RECORDS_IN_BLOCK; i++)
00133         {
00134           int offset = PAGE_HEADER_SIZE + i*(INT_SIZE + str_len);
00135           page_put_int_at(pg, offset, ints_in[i] + bnr);
00136           offset += INT_SIZE;
00137           page_put_str_at(pg, offset, strs_in[i], str_len);
00138           /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After writing a record"); */
00139         }
00140 
00141       /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "Before write_page"); */
00142       write_page (pg);
00143       unpin (pg);
00144       /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After unpin"); */
00145     }
00146 
00147   put_pager_profiler_info (INFO);
00148   pager_terminate ();
00149   /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After pager_terminate"); */
00150   put_msg (INFO, "test_page_write_with_offset() done.\n");
00151 }
00152 
00153 void test_page_read_with_offset (  const char *fname )
00154 {
00155   put_msg (INFO, "test_page_read_with_offset() ...\n");
00156   pager_init ();
00157   /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After pager_init"); */
00158         
00159   page_p pg;
00160   int int_out;
00161   char str_out[14];
00162 
00163   int bnr;
00164   for (bnr = 0; bnr < NUM_BLOCKS_IN_FILE; bnr++)
00165     {
00166       pg = get_page ( fname, bnr );
00167       if ( pg == NULL)
00168         {
00169           put_msg (FATAL, "get_page %d fails\n", bnr);
00170           put_pager_info (FATAL, "After get_page");
00171           exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00172         }
00173 
00174       /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After get_page"); */
00175 
00176       int i = 0;
00177       while (!eob(pg))
00178         {
00179           int offset = PAGE_HEADER_SIZE + i*(INT_SIZE + str_len);
00180           int_out = page_get_int_at(pg, offset);
00181           if ( int_out != ints_in[i] + bnr )
00182             {
00183               put_msg (FATAL,
00184                        "test_page_read fails: (read: %d, should be %d)\n",
00185                        int_out, ints_in[i] + bnr);
00186               put_pager_info (FATAL, "After page_get_int_at");
00187               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00188             }
00189           offset += INT_SIZE;
00190           page_get_str_at (pg, offset, str_out, str_len);
00191           if ( strcmp (str_out, strs_in[i]) != 0 )
00192             {
00193               put_msg (FATAL,
00194                        "test_page_read fails: (read: \"%s\", should be \"%s\")\n",
00195                        str_out, strs_in[i] + bnr);
00196               put_pager_info (FATAL, "After page_get_str_at");
00197               exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
00198             }
00199           i++;
00200         }
00201       unpin (pg);
00202     }
00203 
00204   put_pager_profiler_info (INFO);
00205   pager_terminate ();
00206   /* put_pager_info (DEBUG, "After pager_terminate"); */
00207   put_msg (INFO, "test_page_read_with_offset() succeeds.\n");
00208 }
